position.marginalia_text: Igneus est ollis vigor, et coelestis origo. Axiophili tandem Emblema.

X-ref.text: Igneus est ollis vigor et coelestis origo

marginalia.translation: There is a fiery vigor in them and a celestial origin. At last, the device of Axiophilus.

position.marginalia_text: / Simplicitie Wrangles about trifles: iudgment ) contemnes common debates, & scornes a thousand quarrels.

marginalia.translation: A woman of very few women.
Singular matters either more effectively or more skillfully.

position.marginalia_text: Omnia in Xenophonte, et Ca[e]sare expedita, et quasi sua sponte fluentia. Nihil affectatum. Summa eorum laus

marginalia.translation: In Xenophon and Caesar all things are let loose and flow as if of their own accord. Nothing affected. The praise of their chief points lies in clarity, prudence, and vigor.

position.marginalia_text: Artifex ille est peritus, qui singulas sui corporis, animiq[ue] partes, uel fortiores facit, vel saltem dexteriores, quàm sunt aliorum.

marginalia.translation: Skilled is that artist who makes the singular parts of his body and mind stronger, or at least more dexterous than those of other people.
